description:
I receie weird exception when I try to perform any action with nova ( nova list for example ).
I checked, error that should have been logged is Authorization failed for token.

title: nova logging error

comments.content:
I receie weird exception when I try to perform any action with nova ( nova list for example ).
I checked, error that should have been logged is Authorization failed for token.

"""
Logged from file auth_token.py, line 825
Traceback (most recent call last):

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vb-d

comments.content: Vitalii, can you please more of your log? and tell us which version of nova, python-keystonclient, keystone-middleware (if any) you have on the system?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dims-v

comments.content:
I checked out nova from git recently. It is stable/juno branch.
I took keystone from git as well. 

I use Debian and I installed openstack to virtualenv.

To reproduce the issue you can set keystone_authtoken.admin_tenant_name to empty value.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vb-d

comments.content:
Hi Vitalii 

 Which service are you using? I changed nova.conf to make admin_tenant_name to empty
and nova list command returns 

[root@ip9-114-194-88 ~]# nova list
ERROR (Unauthorized): Unauthorized (HTTP 401) (Request-ID: req-c4837c9b-f84a-4722-92f0-31b69441bd23)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jichenjc

comments.content: [Expired for OpenStack Compute (nova) because there has been no activity for 60 days.]
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~janitor
